                    ### Question
                    All of the following can be used to treat alcohol dependence except

                    ### Options
                    opa. Naltrexone
opb. Acamprosate
opc. Flumazenil
opd. Disulfiram

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Naltrexone is an opioid receptor antagonist that effectively reduces alcohol craving and is used to treat alcohol dependence. Acamprosate modulates the glutamatergic system, helping to reduce cravings and is also indicated for alcohol dependence. Disulfiram works by inhibiting acetaldehyde dehydrogenase, leading to unpleasant reactions when alcohol is consumed, thus deterring use and treating alcohol dependence. In contrast, Flumazenil is a benzodiazepine receptor antagonist primarily used to reverse benzodiazepine effects and is not indicated for treating alcohol dependence. Therefore, the correct answer is Flumazenil, as it does not treat alcohol dependence.
